page.title: 20FOLKLORE OF THE TADLEY AREA
page.content: "Tadley,God help us" so known from the terrified reaction of a villager when asked by the first hot air balloonist ever seen in the area where he had landed; is famous for its 'treacle mines' so called because when a hole for a well was dug on Tadley Common it would fill with a black liquid resembling treacle. This originated from decaying vegetation. Ghosts of the area include a white horse which appears at Halloween on Shalford Bridge at Wasing, while Brimpton boasts a coach and four which plunges into the river at Able Bridge on a January night. A witch, Maria Hale (or Hare) rises from her grave in Aldermaston churchyard and a tradition of placing stones on her grave to prevent this has arisen, but this does not seem to work as people still claim to see her.
